li.text: mode from the “Machine Mode Selection” switch.
Adjust the reference position return feed rate using the “Rapid Traverse Override” switch [1] on the main operation panel.

para.style: margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px;
para.text: This completes the workpiece mounting/removal procedure.

margin-top:8px; margin-left:52px;

table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

para.style: margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px;

td.para: When the Rapid Traverse Override is set to 100%, the axis is moved at the maximum feed rate. Since the Rapid Traverse Override Limit function is activated with the standard settings, the Rapid Traverse feed rate is limited to 25%.

para.style: margin-top:8px; margin-left:52px;

li.text: Select axis to be referenced to zero position using the “Axis Selection” switch [2]. Press and hold either [+] or [-] “Direction Selection” switch [3]. If the axis is away from home position it moves and stops at the reference point after decelerating. If the axis is at the reference point position, the reference will be selected immediately.
Release the “Direction Selection” switch [3] after the zero point return is completed for the axis.
Repeat procedure 2 and 3 for the other axis. Make sure the reference point return completion by referring to Machine Status Display screen by pressing
key. When an axis is in reference condition, the Reference Position Return Status will be shaded as shown.

para.text: This completes the Manual Reference Position Return procedure.

para.style: text-align:center; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:8px; page-break-before:always;
para.draft-comment: Replace the machine status screen figure to "Machine Status Screen" from Chp 11 folder in Graphic folder
